key_points: A 14-year-old boy from Everett is accused of making a shooting threat against three Mukilteo district schools as a joke.
The threat led to six felony charges against the boy, including three for threats to kill and three for threats to bomb.
The threatening message was posted on Instagram and indicated three schools specifically: Explorer, Mariner, Voyager.
Parents reported the post to the police, leading to an increased police presence at the mentioned schools.
The Snohomish County Sheriff's Office has investigated four threats against schools in the past two days.
The student admitted to police he made the post as a joke and to scare a friend, using a fake Instagram account.
He was booked into Denney Juvenile Justice Center and released on $250 bail with conditions.
Recent shooting at a Michigan high school and a past shooting at Marysville Pilchuck High School in 2014 have heightened concerns over school threats in Snohomish County.
Other threats at schools in the county are being investigated, with no immediate danger found.
This incident is part of a noted uptick in school-related threats according to law enforcement and school officials.
spokespersons: Courtney O'Keefe (Spokesperson, Snohomish County Sheriff's Office)
